description: From after- +â€Ž thought, probably modelled on forethought. Compare also the verb afterthink.

entries.meaning: A reflection after an act; a later or subsequent thought, action, or expedient.
examples: She packed her sandals only as an afterthought, but she was glad she did.

entries.meaning: Something additional to the original plan or concept.
examples: This whole remodeling was an afterthought; we were only going to paint and call it good.

verbs.description: afterthought (third-person singular simple present afterthoughts, present participle afterthoughting, simple past and past participle afterthoughted)

entries.meaning: (very rare except in the past tense, possibly nonstandard) To expound as an afterthought.
simple past tense and past participle of afterthink
